attributes.action: Back date money owed by HMRC to families with disabled children
attributes.background: HMRC has announced that it will only pay back money owed to families with disabled children for 2016/17. This is wrong. Families living day to day with the challenges of supporting a disabled child are themselves vulnerable. HMRC must repay all DLA tax credits owed to these families without delay.

attributes.action: Somaliland Recognition
attributes.background:
There is very few and far countries left in the world without full international recognition. Seat with united Nations and all that goes with been a recognise state.
Yet right in the middle of most strategic countries on this planet sets this forgotten  country of Somaliland.
attributes.additional_details:
for the last 25 years its people are calling for the international  community to give them basic freedom to self determine their own affairs and become state. Yet, the Republic of Somaliland has survived to become a relatively stable and democratic state.
Somaliland and UK always had strong ties, working on development, security and regional stability. This can be build Somaliland standing it’s own foot and recognised by statehood

attributes.action: Stop all chain supermarkets selling eggs from battery and barn hens by 2018
attributes.background: We read about the poor conditions that some animals live in and want to end the cruelty. Chickens are a start to achieving our goal because the effects gained from this would be most beneficial.
attributes.additional_details: There are already systems being put into place by some stores, but these aren't expected to come into action for several years. We think that this change should happen quicker so that there is no more unnecessary suffering in the egg industry. We hope that by doing this the supermarkets will eventually eliminate all products that leave animals in terrible, cruel and inhumane situations.

attributes.action: Introduce daily meditation to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We wish to petition for meditation to be introduced into the national curriculum at nursery, primary and secondary levels. The benefits of daily meditation on a developing brain are endless. Focus, clarity, calm - fundamental qualities that can help a young mind stay healthy and happy into adulthood
attributes.additional_details:
"If every 8 year old in the world is taught meditation, we will eliminate violence from the world within one generation." - Dalai Lama

With ever rising rates of young suicides globally our young are becoming ever more detached and disenfranchised. Mental health is now a very serious issue for our growing generations. As little as 5 minutes of gentle meditation each morning will help our young to feel more connected to themselves and the world around them.

attributes.action: To build a new Northern bypass around Ipswich
attributes.background: The Orwell Bridge has been closed in Ipswich all morning due to high winds, causing traffic chaos and gridlock in the town, it's about time a Northern bypass around Ipswich was built to defer the traffic from the town when the bridge is closed.
attributes.additional_details: It's 2016 and it's ridiculous that such a large town is so reliant on the bridge being open, as soon as there's an accident or bad weather, it's closed and the traffic has nowhere to go but through the town, which the infrastructure just cannot cope, costing businesses millions of pounds in lost revenue, especially haulage companies as they're reliant on the a14 to and from the port of felixstowe, get this Northern bypass built.

attributes.action: Resurface the A11 between Attleborough Wymondham
attributes.background: The government are talking about spending 3 plus billion pounds on improving congested roads, not a bad thing. But we have a stretch of road between that the surface is diabolic it is dangerous for all road uses, it desperately needs doing before some gets killed.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the section is made from concrete, when cracks, pot holes etc. Appear they are being patch with tarmac, as soon as the weather is bad these repair break down and the holes reappear.

attributes.action: hold referendum on ending public financing of the royal family.
attributes.background: redecorating Buckingham palace will cost the taxpayer 367 million pounds, why isn't this very wealthy family responsible for the maintenance of the properties they live in? A referendum should be held for us to decide if they should continue to receive any finance from British taxpayers.

attributes.action: Fully and transparently explore the Hyperloop concept to deliver HS1 and HS2.
attributes.background:
The proposed HS1 and HS2 investments should deliver infrastructure for the future - but they are currently on-target to deploy a concept that hasn't improved since the Victorian era.

The Hyperloop is different. It offers the potential for high speeds and sustainability. We should evaluate it.
attributes.additional_details:
Full details of the design and rationale can be found here:

https://www.tesla.com/en_GB/blog/hyperloop

attributes.action: Introduce online cyber-security and forensics degree courses for UK residents.
attributes.background: I am requesting the UK Government to introduce affordable and highly rated cyber-security and forensic degree courses for people with hidden conditions and other people alike all over the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: This would fulfill the dreams for those wishing to pursue security degree courses. Most national cyber threats could be eliminated by simply introducing online degree course in conjunction with some of our reputed universities.

attributes.action: Mobile phone use whilst driving have the same penalties as drink/drugs driving.
attributes.background: Mobile phone use whilst driving appears to be killing or maiming as many people as drink/drug related accidents, therefore should carry the same penalty.

attributes.action: The British Government should apologize for the Balfour Declaration.
attributes.background:
The British Government promised a land that was not in their possession. They should claim partial responsibility for the suffering of the Palestinian people. 
The Palestinian people deserve an apology.
attributes.additional_details:
The Palestinian people need support and Israel needs to be pressured. I believe we should have two states for two people. 
The British government needs to support the Palestinian people in their pursuit of statehood.
The best way to start will be by apologising to the Palestinian people.

attributes.action: England : have a referendum to leave the U.k. thus leaving the EU automatically
attributes.background:
As the UK is a political entity within the EU. If England would vote to leave the U.K. Then England would automatically become its own country outside the UK and the EU. No article 50 needed. No negotiations beforehand. 

The Scottish referendum made this clear to any country that leaves the U.K.

attributes.action: Legislate against premature marketing of festivals, especially Christmas
attributes.background: The excitement of Christmas is spoiled by premature marketing in shops, 'papers and TV. We are not killjoys, but tinselled TV ads and festive trees in Malls in early November dwindles our joy well before the event. We propose, under penalty, the first day of marketing for Christmas as 1st of Dec.
attributes.additional_details: Other festivals can be included in legislation (e.g. 1 week prior to Valentines, Easter, Halloween) but the law must first target Christmas. We accept there are commercial ventures that that may be exempt since they rely on festivals such as Christmas for much of their business and therefore need to market early, e.g. Christmas hamper savings, turkey butchers, greeting card shops, booking for a Christmas party, etc. Punishments for breaking the law should raise money for children's charities.

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: Ban advertising of alcohol, restrict opening times, picture of damaged liver
attributes.background:
In September of this year my partner Claire died due to long term alcohol dependancy, more or less my last words to Claire was that I was going to try and help others in the same situation. 

Being alcohol dependant doesn't just effect the person it also effects close family and friends
attributes.additional_details:
What people don't realise is what damage drinking too much  alcohol can do, in many cases people with liver disease don't have any noticeable symptoms until their live is badly damaged. 
Those systems are.
Jaundice,Oadema, swelling in abdomen, itchy skin, weakness and muscle wasting,insomnia nose bleeds and bleeding gums.
To give you some figures on alcohol abuse it cost the NHS  £2000 per day for a level 3 patient on intensive care It is commonly said that it costs overall to the society £21 bn

attributes.action: Parliament must vote on initial aims of Brexit and then trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: The country voted 52:48 to leave the EU in June and to make Parliament sovereign in the UK. To be sovereign, Parliament must therefore be able to vote on and scrutinise the initial aims for Brexit negotiations and then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered, not leaving it to royal prerogative.
attributes.additional_details: In determining the starting point of Brexit, our elected representatives must have the chance to properly scrutinise and vote on the aims of the negotiations. MPs must engage with their constituents and all stakeholders to represent us, the people, in determining what the aims of Brexit should be. Our elected MPs should then vote to ensure article 50 is triggered so negotiations start following these aims set out by Parliament. To be truly sovereign, Parliament must play its full role in Brexit.

attributes.action: Free sanitary products for public restrooms so homeless women can still get them
attributes.background: Homeless woman are less likely to get these products as they will have to choose between food or these products, if we had free ones in public restrooms it would help them in the long run.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools with social media accounts to be set to private.
attributes.background: The primary school my children attend has a public Twitter profile that they post photos of the children on. 3 explicit Twitter profiles have retweeted and liked a photo of my child. It was brought to my attention that the school profile is public and it is not compulsory to have it set to private.
attributes.additional_details: A public twitter account allows anyone to access details of what school a child goes to, their name and also what they look like. The pictures can be saved by any person who wishes. The terrifying thing is that an individual doesn't even have to have a Twitter account themselves to access a public account. The school my children attend are refusing to make the account private as there is nothing to say they have to. I want it to be made compulsory for all schools with social media accounts to have them set to private.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a parent to allow child access to age inappropriate material
attributes.background: This needs to happen sooner rather than later because the technology is becoming more of the norm for young impressionable children and games that glorifying gang affiliations, drug dealing , mass shootings act now for our next generation of leaders

attributes.action: increase penalties for leaving the scene of an accident in a motor vehicle
attributes.background: I wish to increase the penalties emposed to drivers if found leaving the scene of an accident. I feel dissapointed that police do not enforce sufficient penalties for people who leave someone or something for dead at sides of roads after hitting them. same applies to accidents with vehicles
attributes.additional_details: Spring hill road - accrington - DOG Killed by speeding driver who made off, leaving owner at side of road in a state with no way of knowing who killed her dog. police was informed and she was told without a number plate we cant help.

attributes.action: bikers with a CBT dont have to ride with L plates after 2 years on the road
attributes.background: riding with L plates and riding without any L plates make no difference on a bike all they do is keep breaking off and left laying on the road making it a hazard
attributes.additional_details:
L plate left laying on the road is a hazard , it is a danger to other bikers it could pop a Tyre and cause serious body damage or even death 

it also can be just as dangerous to car drivers or buses/lorry's as if they cant control a blow out they could end up going in to a head on crash or in to a pedestrian walking on the pavement 

can also be a danger if a vehicle drives over  a L plate it could be brought up in the air and his a vehicle following behind

attributes.action: Create more awareness and help for Children affected and bereaved by Suicide.
attributes.background: Suicide is often a joke among people, this may affect one of the survivors of 4400 suicide attempts taken place per year. More should be done to raise empathy and support for bereaved/affected children in schools. Also there is a lack of widespread support available, e.g. specialised therapists.

attributes.action: Make single carriageway A-roads safer
attributes.background: Single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. With a record £6m investment in our road network, the Government should legislate for physical barriers on single carriageway A-roads to prevent head on collisions, and for a reduction in the speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the Road Safety Foundation concluded that single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. Having been involved in a high speed head on collision on a single carriageway A-road, a physical barrier in the middle of the road would prevent unscrupulous drivers from overtaking, thus eradicating the possibility of a head on collision. Moreover, a reduction in the speed limit from 60mph would also further improve road safety.

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: Abolish assured shorthold tenancies
attributes.background: Assured shorthold tenancies provide no security whatsoever for those in private rented accommodation. With tenancies being restricted to as little as six months, hard working families find themselves not knowing where or even if they are going to have a roof over their head in the immediate future.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage to 8 pounds per hour
attributes.background: The minimum wage is 7.20 an hour for over 25 year old this is a joke...company directors share holders and the rich are getting ever richer off the backs of the poor it's shamefull that in this country the top 1 percent have over 90 percent of the wealth..

attributes.action: Take more action to reduce activities that contribute to global climate change.
attributes.background: Deployment of mitigation technologies, as well as deployment of non fossil fuel energy sources will be necessary to achieve a stabilization of the concentration of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere. Support renewables, divest from fossil fuels, tackle pollution and stop Fracking.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.greenfacts.org/en/climate-change-ar4/
http://www.greenfacts.org/en/climate-change-ar5-science-basis/index.htm
One Million Climate Jobs: Tackling the Environmental and Economic Crisis http://www.campaigncc.org/climatejobs

attributes.action: Make Manston airport UK air freight port, Gatwick & Heathrow passenger airports
attributes.background: The former Manston  RAF airstrip has an existing runway capable of use by largest  air freight planes. Thanet has good infrastructure, close to  ports of Dover & Ramsgate. Transferring all air freight  to Manston would eliminate need for third runway at Gatwick or Heathrow & improve air quality .
attributes.additional_details:
Surrounded on 2 sides by sea & closer to Europe and China than Gatwick or Heathrow. Air freight at Manston would reduce the millions of freight lorries passing through the port of Dover where infrastructure is very poor. Encourage development at the ports of Ramsgate and Tilbury make a new Thames crossing more financially viable 
Reduce high air pollution levels in Dover & Southeast
The population of Thanet & UKIP led council want an airport at Manston and need the employment opportunity.

attributes.action: Stop fines to parents who holiday in term time or stop companies raising prices.
attributes.background: It's not fair or right for holiday companies to raise prices during school holidays and for local authorities to fine parents for taking their children out of school during term time. Some companies charge hundred so of pounds more and the majority of ordinary working people are being penalised.
attributes.additional_details: It's not difficult to find the evidence just search for any holiday during term time and check the dates either side of the school holidays!

attributes.action: Erect a statue of Nye Bevan in the Houses of Parliament celebrating the NHS.
attributes.background: The founder of the greatest achievment this country has witnessed should be recognised, by a statue in the houses of parliament.

attributes.action: Include MPs from all political parties in the negotiations team for Brexit
attributes.background: The negotiated results will be permanent and are too important to be subject to party politics.  Approaches to strategy and policy could be designed to make sure no one party would be able to obstruct the process. It would help to re-unite the UK and lead to a better outcome for all of us.

attributes.action: Increase funding for an EHCP to allow mainstream schools to get the correct help
attributes.background: I have been fighting for 3 years to get an EHCP for my child, he now has one but with very little funding so he is unable to get the right help at school. He is missing out on education at a very important stage of his life. This process is effecting hundreds of SEN children, it's not fair.

attributes.action: Debate the referendum results before the Article 50 vote
attributes.background: The margin was just over 1m of 33.5m voted/46.5m eligible; areas of high immigration voted remain; under 44 year olds voted remain (18-24: 73%, 25-34: 62; and 35-44 58%); Scotland and Northern Ireland voted remain.
attributes.additional_details: MPs need to uphold their duty to act in the interests of the nation as a whole  and claims of a 'decisive' vote are inaccurate

attributes.action: Compel energy providers to offer the cheapest tariffs on pre-pay meters.
attributes.background: Users of pre-pay meters are unfairly disadvantaged when purchasing energy to heat their homes. Although often on lower incomes they actually have to pay a higher rate. This is "fuel poverty" - higher tariffs result in people going without food or other essentials as they just try to keep warm.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/19/fuel-poverty-heating-disabled-cold-penalised-energy-tariff

attributes.action: To invest money in local government so they can support homeless shelters.
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students from Greenwood Academy in Birmingham studying GCSE Citizenship. For a campaign we feel in our local area that there is not enough support given to aid local government in building more homeless shelters and provide assistance to those who need it.

attributes.action: Drivers of motor vehicles to use headlights at all times of the day and night.
attributes.background: Vehicles are often driven in poor light conditions. Vehicle colourings can make them nearly invisible against background colours. In daylight they can also be difficult to see. Compulsory headlights would make vehicles more visible and improve road safety. A no cost issue to motorists. A WIN WIN.

attributes.action: Impose minimum standards for UK phone network providers to meet.
attributes.background: Having tried several networks over the years I found that non of our providers can supply a minimum standard phone signal across Norfolk, yet we are now being told about 5G most of us bearly get signal for a call or text or 2G. Our phones are for our safety and with no signal we are not safe.

attributes.action: Ban strikes 1 week before and after the top 10 designated 'peak use' times p/a
attributes.background:
Striking should not be targeted at consumers. 

As strikes cite reasons such as 'safety' for their end purposes, there is no legitimate reason to arrange strikes around the busiest / highest consumer use times. 

This petition would stop consumer suffering whilst still protecting workers rights.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence in plentiful supply today, looking at post offices, airports, trains etc.

attributes.action: Make it 'illegal' to setup None Legal Encampment's, with the Police given Powers
attributes.background:
The Police must be given the Powers to Remove people as they Arrive, it should not be for the Councils and Land Owners to Waste money taking Action, also any Mess/Damage must be got from the ones who caused it like breaking in, and Human Waste.
At this time it is Unfair that Council Money is Waste
attributes.additional_details:
Some in the Traveling sector cause issues with Locals, Fly Tip, our council plus the City council have had to pay out good money in Repairs with one area which a school uses closed for eight days cleaning up their mess and repairs to the grass area, another they lifted out posts to a play area, cut chains on gates Only to be moved on to do the same again, No Law in this practice.

Let's make the Laws apply to All.

attributes.action: Stop the College of Policing requiring Police to have a degree before joining.
attributes.background: The College of policing are requiring new officers to have a degree or a 3 year apprenticeship before joining. Currently there are around 38% of officers who have a degree. As a current special constable alot of the officers I serve with haven't got a degree and their policing skills are fantastic!

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: Solve the gridlock occuring on the M5 between Almondsbury & Clevedon.
attributes.background: Due to the design of the Avonmouth Bridge, the 3 mile long queues to leave the M5 at junction 19 (Portishead) both morning and evening, repeated accidents between junctions 18 and 19, in part due to road design, inpart due to careless driving, life on the M5 is now intolerable.
attributes.additional_details: One needs only reference Inrix, view CCTV or stand on a bridge to see the chaos and misery caused to locals, commuter, holiday makers and businesses. Now is the time to design a 2nd Avonmouth crossing, take local traffic for Portishead off at junction 18 (or use a design similar to J5-6, M20), bulldoze Gordano services, redesign junction 19, put in SMART motorway, widen the carriageways and if necessary re-route the motorway for long distance traffic from junction 15 to a new junction 19A.

attributes.action: Open places for homeless and people alone to socialise
attributes.background: With Christmas day coming up many people will be spending it alone and walking into new year alone, this petition is to try and get the government to agree to try and fund places for people like this. As people of the community to volunteer to help give the homeless and others to not feel alone.
attributes.additional_details: This may not be an issue for the government to agree on but it could be possible for them to consider funding socialise centres! Yes we have many places for these people like "feed the homeless" but what about the people sat alone on Christmas Day with nobody, reminding themselves they are alone! By signing this it will show the government their funding would be useful and many people in the community would love the opportunity to volunteer. Thankyou for reading please sign! See what we can do.

attributes.action: Terminate the tax free benefits enjoyed by religious institutions.
attributes.background:
Churches, mosques and synagogues don't pay any tax on earnings or land owned, yet they often preach about social responsibility.
To really help the local communities in which they thrive they should give something back in the form of taxes.
attributes.additional_details:
In light of the fact we are rapidly moving toward a more secular society, why should we still be subsidising religion via tax exemption?
The church often takes a political stance during times of crisis. Most recently the humanitarian disaster that is the refugee exodus, has the church not got a moral responsibility to contribute some of its vast wealth? Now lets make it a legal one too.

attributes.action: Put a max of £3000 per year for undergraduate courses at university
attributes.background: University students are currently paying £9000-£9250 per year to study at university; seeing as there are no more grants, this is EXTREMELY unaffordable. Many graduates still tend to remain unemployed with a £27000 debt on their mind. Therefore, the amount should be altered to £3000 per year.

attributes.action: Amend voting age to reflect the school year
attributes.background:
This petition aims to grant the right to vote to second-year college students; in other words, to 17-year-olds who will pass their 18th birthday within the same school year as the vote.

We should recognise that students in the same school year have the same intellectual and cultural maturity.
attributes.additional_details:
To make an adequate generalisation about the societal and cultural awareness of young people, it would make much more sense to rely on their years of education; limiting voting by age is arbitrary.

For example, in the General Election 2015, students in their final year of college were only eligible to vote depending on whether their 18th birthday fell before or after May 7th. We should recognise that a period of a few days is inconsequential.

Colleges could then encourage youth participation.

attributes.action: Require that all single use drinks cups are 100% biodegradable.
attributes.background: Currently only around 1 in every 400 single use drinks cups, mainly used for takeaway coffee are recycled.  Many such cups end up littering our pavements, parks, beaches and rivers. It is time that all such cups should be 100% biodegradable to minimise their impact on the environment.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Introduce the drinking age of 21
attributes.background:
Alcohol has many side affects. It's scientifically proved that it can damage the devolving brain cells of the teenagers.
However the majority of 21 year old are fully developed, therefore the effects of alcohol upon the brain is significantly lower.
